displayName: Asgard - Realm of the Aesir Gods
description: Asgard (Old Norse: √Åsgar√∞r, "enclosure of the √Üsir") is the celestial realm of the Aesir gods in Norse mythology. It sits at the top of Yggdrasil, the World Tree, and is one of the Nine Realms that make up the Norse cosmos. Unlike the Christian concept of Heaven as an eternal paradise, Asgard is a fortress‚Äîa place of strength and preparation for the final battle of Ragnarok.
name: Norse Cosmology

Ragnarok (Old Norse: Ragnar√∂k or Ragnar√∏kkr) is the prophesied end of the cosmos in Norse mythology‚Äîa series of catastrophic events culminating in a great battle that will result in the deaths of numerous gods, the destruction of the Nine Realms, and the submersion of the world in water. Yet from this destruction, a new world will arise, purified and renewed.
name: Norse Cosmology

description: Yggdrasil (Old Norse: Yggdrasill) is the enormous ash tree that stands at the center of the Norse cosmos, connecting all Nine Realms. The tree is not merely large‚Äîit is described as stretching across all of existence, with branches that reach into the heavens and roots that delve into the deepest underworld. It is both the physical and spiritual axis mundi (center of the world) around which all cosmic activity revolves.
name: Norse Cosmology
